thread.title: Smugshot: Readers' travel photos of the week
thread.title_full: Smugshot: Readers' travel photos of the week

title: Smugshot: Readers' travel photos of the week
text:
Smugshot: Readers' travel photos of the week Last updated 13:41, August 10 2015 Fred Aron 
It was or first time up on Mt Wellington domain. We visited our friends in Auckland and they were kind enough to tour us around. I was taking pictures of my daughter but suddenly I saw my friends' niece Hannah running towards a lone tree, so I took several shots of her. This is the only one that you can see her as the she was hidden on the trees' shadow on the rest of the shot. 
From stunning lakes in Asia, to pristine national parks in the US, we've received hundreds of photos from our readers, proving what an intrepid bunch Kiwi travellers are. 
This week we have two winners for our readers' travel photo competition. 
Congratulations to Fred Aron, June's winner, for a spectular photo taken on Mt Wellington domain. Nicola Pye 
We took the kids skiing last weekend, and while we missed the snow back home, we were lucky enough to catch just a beautiful little bit of it in Queenstown. It felt just like we were walking through a Christmas movie set! Full credit to the kidlets for sitting still on the frozen bench for long enough for me to get a photo :-) 
And congratulations to July's winner, Nicola Pye, for a stunning shot captured on a snowy day in Queenstown. 
Smugshot is taking a small break but we will be back soon. Watch this space!
